meanings.definition: Regies (noun): plural form of regie, meaning a government monopoly or state-owned enterprise
meanings.sent1: The regies in this country control all the major industries.
meanings.sent2: She studied the history of regies in different countries.
meanings.sent3: The regies decided to open up new branches in other cities.
meanings.sent4: The regies of the business world clashed in a fierce competition.
meanings.sent5: The regies of the past shaped the economy of the nation.

meanings.definition: Regies (verb): third person singular present of regie, meaning to manage or control
meanings.sent1: He regies the company with a firm hand.
meanings.sent2: She regies the household budget efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The cat regies the house, making sure everything is in order.
meanings.sent4: The coach regies the team with discipline and strategy.
meanings.sent5: The teacher regies the classroom with kindness and fairness.

meanings.definition: Regies (adjective): comparative form of regie, meaning more authoritative or controlling
meanings.sent1: She has a regies approach to leadership.
meanings.sent2: The regies manager made all the decisions.
meanings.sent3: The regies boss always expects perfection from the employees.
meanings.sent4: His regies demeanor intimidated those around him.
meanings.sent5: The regies attitude of the supervisor created a tense work environment.
